p:
Replication of the overall percentages seen in Figs 5 and 6 extend to more detailed analyses as well, although sample-to-sample variation increases as we look at smaller subsamples. For example,
Fig 7 tracks climate-change percentages separately for each political party, across 34 New Hampshire surveys. The four parties exhibit roughly parallel upward trends. Separation into five levels of ideology from liberal to conservative (not shown) paints a similar picture as well.
